title: Higher latitude chain (Lat 56.3, Long 239.2), Ground-based Vector Magnetic Field at Fort St., John, BC, Canada, 1.0 sec STEP Polar Network, available through AUTUMN network - Kanji Hayashi (U Tokyo, Japan)

parameters.name: thg_mag_fsj
parameters.description: Magnetic field B in HDZ vector components

parameters.name: thg_magh_fsj
parameters.description: ---> H - Local magnetic North component of B. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['thg_mag_fsj']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: thg_magd_fsj
parameters.description: ---> E - Local magnetic East component of B. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['thg_mag_fsj']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: thg_magz_fsj
parameters.description: ---> Z - Local vertical down component of B. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['thg_mag_fsj']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
